ExampleDefinition.ToolTipDescription:
Demonstrates mouse-dragging of SciChart constrained to the X or Y axis.
Overlays a mountain (area) and line chart series on a SciChartSurface and applies the ZoomPanModifier. This is a built-in ChartModifierBase derived class which adds the behavior of panning on mouse-drag.
This example uses secondary Y-axis to showcase panning when there is a left or right Y-Axis.
ExampleDefinition.Description:
Demonstrates using the [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v4.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.ChartModifiers.ZoomPanModifier.html']ZoomPanModifier[/url], part of the [url='http://support.scichart.com/index.php?/Knowledgebase/List/Index/32']ChartModifier API[/url], which allows panning the chart while dragging the mouse.
Mouse-dragging of of the SciChartSurface causes the viewport to pan.
[b][i]Tips![/i][/b]
- With the [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v4.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.ChartModifiers.ZoomPanModifierBase~XyDirection.html']ZoomPanModifier.XyDirection[/url] property, Panning may be limited to the X Direction, Y Direction or XY (both) directions.
- With the [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v4.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.ChartModifiers.ZoomPanModifierBase~ZoomExtentsY.html']ZoomPanModifier.ZoomExtentsY[/url] property, the YAxis zooms to extents as you pan. This is useful for trading charts.
- When the [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v4.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.ChartModifiers.ZoomPanModifierBase~ClipModeX.html']ZoomPanModifier.ClipModeX[/url] property, you can control how the series behaves as you pan to the edge of the data. The default mode is ClipMode.StretchAtExtents, which causes a zooming (stretch) action when you reach the edge of the data.
- The ZoomPanModifier may be disabled on one or more axis by setting the attached property ZoomPanModifier.IncludeSeries="False" on an Axis. The default value is true.
